Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); 18TH DYNASTY ?; NEW KINGDOM (not after)
Name: Vase with oval bottom
Description: This beautiful vase of terracotta comes from the excavations of W. Loat at Gurob in 1903-1904. It is characterised by an elongated belly with an oval bottom and fitted with two handles. The long neck is ornamented with a projecting edge. This type of receptacle is often represented in the Theban tombs of the 18th Dynasty.
